p: The cerebellum is historically considered a region of the brain showing little vulnerability for AD [ 6], although recent studies also link cerebellum to cognitive decline [ 16, 18]. Robust SORLA expression in cerebellum in AD has previously been observed [ 5, 13, 30,Â 38] despite decreased levels in disease-affected regions including frontal cortex and hippocampus [ 1, 14, 30]. However, these previous studies did not take into account that alternative isoforms of SORL1 may be altered. As dendritic and synaptic connectivity loss is one of the driving events occurring in AD, we next asked if SORL1-38b levels are affected in the cerebellum of AD patients.
